item.title: Beyond email: could startup Slack change the way you work?
item.description:
Beyond email: could startup Slack change the way you work?

Erica Baker likes poker. So did many of the engineers she spent 10 years working with at Google, in the California headquarters of one of the world's most valuable technology companies. When she was eventually invited to a poker night with other engineers, the group of white, male colleagues fell silent as she walked into the room.

item.title: The Conservatism of Emoji
item.description:
The Conservatism of Emoji

Emoji offer you new possibilities for digital expression, but only if you're speaking their language If you smile through your fear and sorrow Smile and maybe tomorrow You'll see the sun come shining through for you -Nat King Cole, "Smile" The world will soon have its first emoji-only social network: Emoj.li.

item.title: Building Infrastructure for More Inclusive Communities
item.description:
Building Infrastructure for More Inclusive Communities

As the creator of the Atlanta BeltLine project, Ryan Gravel is partly responsible for one of the most successful sustainability efforts in recent history. Starting as the subject of Gravel's master thesis back in 1999, the BeltLine is now credited with reducing sprawl, limiting car-dependence, and generating a vibrant cultural hub within the city of Atlanta.

item.title: How Slack Reflects the Values of Organization Development
item.description:
How Slack Reflects the Values of Organization Development

How Slack Reflects the Values of Organization Development Zachary D. Winter Sonoma State University Abstract The purpose of this research is to identify the ways that the enterprise software platform Slack mirrors the core values of Organization Development. A phenomenological research approach is used to study the experience of Slack users, and the effects its implementation has on the organization.
